result.execSummary:
The defendant Sade L Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 2 days sentence credit.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are waived.  DNA surcharge is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Comply and follow through with all court orders out of Juvenile Court.
Court will allow for visitation/placement with the minor children as ordered through the Juvenile Court.
Defendant not to use any physical discipline of her children.
No use or possession of any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No violent contact with the victim or any other family member.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sade L Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations returned.

Discharge - Regular
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date:  08-27-2016
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sade L Williams in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
6 Months  in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
2 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Comply and follow through with all court orders out of Juvenile Court.
Court will allow for visitation/placement with the minor children as ordered through the Juvenile court.
Defendant not to use any physical discipline of her children.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  victim or anyother family member.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  Court Waives.
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sade L Williams in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   

Atty. Weathers presented statements to the court.
Defense still in negotiations with the State.  Hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sade L Williams in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Sade L Williams in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint. No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.

Defendant Sade L Williams in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
